metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0739 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libssh before 0.7.3 improperly truncates ephemeral secrets generated for the (1) diffie-hellman-group1 and (2) diffie-hellman-group14 key exchange methods to 128 bits, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to decrypt or intercept SSH sessions via unspecified vectors, aka a "bits/bytes confusion bug."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0739` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.6.1-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> affects "all versions of libssh 0.1 and later"

criterions.comment: libssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-0ubuntu3.3').
